Vehicles.VehicleBuildDef.label: Benz Patent-Motorwagen
Vehicles.VehicleBuildDef.description:
The Benz Patent-Motorwagen, built in 1885 by Karl Benz, is widely regarded as the first practical automobile. It was a three-wheeled vehicle powered by a single-cylinder, four-stroke engine. Benz patented the design in 1886, marking the birth of the modern car.

Consumes a lot of fuel, and is best used for short to medium distances.

<color=#bb8f04>Crew:</color> Driver x1
<color=#bb8f04>Fuel type:</color> Chemfuel
